Key Match Events: The Thunder dominated from the second quarter onwards, outscoring the Rockets 41-20 to take a 75-51 lead at halftime.
Gilgeous-Alexander made 10 of his first 11 field goals and didn’t take a 3-pointer until his 13th shot.
Holmgren made 8 of 14 field goals, including 4 of 6 3-pointers, for the Thunder.
Post-Match Reflections: The Thunder showed why they lead the league in defensive rating when they shut down Houston’s top two scorers, Jalen Green and Alperen Sengun.
Oklahoma City’s depth and versatility were too much for the Rockets.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Thunder shot 51.1% from the field and made 20 of 23 free throws.
Dillon Brooks scored 17 points for the Rockets, who shot just 43.3% from the field.
Others: The game was tied at 31 early in the second quarter when Oklahoma City’s Aaron Wiggins hit a 3-pointer.
The Thunder had been inconsistent on offense so far this season, but they figured things out in this game.
